content.description: Long line that tops out well above the Low Standard cave. Hard start gets you into some easier mileage through the middle. Small roof up-top finishes it off, leaving you with a small reminder of its 5.12 grade.
content.location: Vertical section to the right of the cave- right of Sodomizing Satan/ left of Oneida (round the corner). Awkward start, in-and-around a bush.

content.description:
Work up the back wall into underclings and start to traverse out the roof on good cobbles. Make the move out to the obvious flake and catch your breath. Hard moves gain the horizontal, rest well. A few moves on thin holds up the short headwall gains the anchor.

As a note, there is quite a bit of glue on this route but the movement is excellent.
content.location: The route starts as the first route at the right edge of the cave and climbs straight up, there are variations that branch to the left from about mid height.

content.description:
Awful name - fun climb. At the base of this climb somebody has etched 11b. The

Jason Stevens

guidebook rated it 11d. So go climb it and you decide. It's just past vertical and technical with tricky feet. The crux is the last move to chains. Teeny crimpers to a bigger hold to the left of the chains. You can skip the crimpers and make a big throw to the hold.

Felt 11b until the last move then that move was considerably harder.
Bouldery start then lets up some past the first 3 bolts. Then at the upper bulge it's a cruxy crimpfest. Well protected. A very long endurance route.
content.location: Located to the right of "When Cobbles Fly". Just around corner.

content.description: Small holds with tricky small feet to a fun undercling and better holds to chain biners.
content.location:
First vertical climb to the left of

Gutter Dike

.

content.description: A really fun long route full of cobbles
content.location: First climb to the left on this wall

content.description: this steep route ascends to the apex of the cave at the very deepest part of the cave.  At the fourth bolt, the holds get a bit smaller and the moves feel about 5.11c, but I couldn't figure out how to clip the chains, so that seemed to be the crux to me.  I don't know if something has broken off, but clipping the chains felt much harder than 5.11c.
content.location: This route is at the very back of the cave on the right hand wall and goes up to the chains in the apex of the cave.

content.description:
Bouldery! This is a very powerful problem right off the ground and moves through a steep bulge up and to the right. Wolverrine guidebook for Maple describes it as, "a v7(with a clip)"

First crux is down low, followed by big, powerful movements between ok cobbles
content.protection:
5 or 6 bolts to unevenly hung chains

Shares anchors with Nipple Stud and the first pitch of Gutter Dyke
content.location:
This is the right-most route in the cave. Scramble up the small mound of rocks to begin the route.

Since the route trends to the right on the bulge, it makes the route somewhat difficult to clean.

content.description:
P1

(35', 5.10b) - Find the good holds to keep it a warm-up. Be sure to move left at the 4th bolt or you may wonder where the .10b route went. -jross

P2

(30', 5.9) - Well protected and sort-of fun, but somewhat chossy (make sure no one is below you) and the upper crack is chock full of guano. Nearly a bomb, but I'd give it 1 star I spose. -Zoso

P3

(35'?, 5.11a) - (If you climb this pitch please PM the updates so it can be posted here.)
content.protection:
P1

- 4 bolts to chains out left

P2

- 5 bolts and a fixed nut (6 draws) to chain anchors

P3

- about 8 bolts to chains

Rappel from the top of P3 with one 60m rope.
content.location:
Found on the right side of the cave, this route follows the first four bolts of

Sodomizing Satan

.11d

, then moves left to it's own chains.

content.description: Although short, this is a very cool route.   Climb up and traverse right the entire way.   There's a great kneebar just below the 4th bolt that makes this section substantially easier.  Many overhead heel hooks are the ticket as you traverse right toward the finish.   Hellish drag when you are trying to clean this one, not too sweet for the rope.
content.location: On the left edge of the cave.  To the right of Morning Moo's.

content.description:
Climb Welcome to Fitness branching left at the large rail at mid height.  Jugs lead to some pocket pulling up a neat prow feature that is right of the large hole - 12d variation ends in the hole.

Similar to the bottom of this climb you will be pulling on glue as much as rock, but the moves are a blast and slightly harder than at the end of Welcome.....
content.protection: 13 + chains - several are frequently skipped as they are very closely spaced.
